​

The graph consists of 9 plotted points connected by line segments. The plotted points have the following coordinates, in sequence:

(negative 4 comma negative 2)

(negative 3 comma negative 2)

(negative 2 comma negative 2)

(negative 1 comma negative 1)

(0 comma negative 1)

(1 comma negative 1)

(2 comma 0)

(3 comma 1)

(4 comma 2)

​The piecewise-linear function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, defined on <math alttext="negative 4 less or equal than x less or equal than 4"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, is shown in the graph. The function <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals x plus 3"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following is the graph of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses g open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?
